Article.ArticleTitle: Heart rate cost of running in track estimates velocity associated with maximal oxygen uptake.

AbstractText: Running velocity associated with VO<sub>2</sub>max (vVO<sub>2</sub>max) is a parameter widely used for exercise prescription and is related to endurance performance. However, the vVO<sub>2</sub>max determination usually requires a maximal effort test and equipped laboratory for expired gas analysis, what make difficulty its assessment.

We aimed to test the validity of a simple method of vVO<sub>2</sub>max prediction through the heart rate cost of running (HRC) in a submaximal 6-min running test, both in treadmill and in a 400-meter track.

Male recreational runners (n = 16; 30.3 ± 8.0 years; VO<sub>2</sub>max of 46.2 ± 3.2 ml·kg<sup>-1</sup>·min<sup>-1</sup>) randomly underwent an incremental test in treadmill with gas analysis, and a 3000-m time trial in a track, to determine vVO<sub>2</sub>max. Before every maximal test, participants also performed a submaximal 6-min running (~85% HRmax), both in the treadmill and in a track, to assess HRC (bpm<sup>-1</sup>m·min<sup>-1</sup>) by dividing the submaximal running velocity by its respective HR. The vVO<sub>2</sub>max (km·h<sup>-1</sup>) was predicted by dividing the HRmax (bpm)/HRC (bpm<sup>-1</sup>m·min<sup>-1</sup>).

No differences were verified (p > .05) among vVO<sub>2</sub>max determined both in the treadmill (13.8 ± 0.9 km·h<sup>-1</sup>) and track (13.6 ± 0.9 km·h<sup>-1</sup>) to those predicted by the HRC method both in treadmill (13.5 ± 0.8 km·h<sup>-1</sup>) and track (13.6 ± 1.0 km·h<sup>-1</sup>). The vVO<sub>2</sub>max measured directly with expired gas analysis was highly correlated with vVO<sub>2</sub>max estimated through HRC in treadmill and track (p < .05). Additionally, the intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) and Bland-Altman technique revealed good agreement and reliability classified with substantial agreement [ICC = 0.673 (95% CI 0.064-0.886; p = .019)] and almost perfect agreement [ICC = 0.870 (95% CI 0.628-0.955 p = .0001)] between methods to identify vVO<sub>2</sub>max, respectively.
A submaximal 6-min exercise test protocol to assess HRC of running was considered valid to estimate vVO<sub>2</sub>max of recreational runners both in treadmill and outdoor track.
